hints.label: axiom-local-gauge-transformation
hints.title: Local Gauge Transformation (To Be Defined)
hints.content:
859: :label: axiom-local-gauge-transformation
860: 
861: Define a local U(1) gauge transformation on walker states:
862: 
863: $$
864: |\psi_i(t)\rangle \to |\psi'_i(t)\rangle = e^{i\alpha_i(t)} |\psi_i(t)\rangle
865: $$
866: 
867: where α_i(t) is an arbitrary smooth function of walker index i and time t.

hints.label: prop-collective-field-transformation
hints.title: Non-Trivial Transformation of Collective Fields (To Be Proven)
hints.content:
873: :label: prop-collective-field-transformation
874: 
875: Under the local gauge transformation {prf:ref}`axiom-local-gauge-transformation`, prove that the collective fields transform as:
876: 
877: $$
878: d'_i \to d'_i + \Delta_i[\alpha] + O(\alpha^2)
879: $$
880: 
881: $$
882: r'_i \to r'_i + \Gamma_i[\alpha] + O(\alpha^2)
883: $$
884: 
885: where Δ_i[α] and Γ_i[α] are non-zero functionals depending on the gauge parameter α and its derivatives.

hints.label: thm-observable-gauge-invariance
hints.title: Gauge Invariance of Physical Observables (To Be Proven)
hints.content:
891: :label: thm-observable-gauge-invariance
892: 
893: Assuming {prf:ref}`prop-collective-field-transformation` holds, prove that physical observables are gauge-invariant:
894: 
895: 1. **Total cloning probability:**
896: 
897: $$
898: P_{\text{total}}(i,j) := P_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) + P_{\text{clone}}(j \to i)
899: $$
900: 
901: is gauge-invariant (as claimed in {doc}`03_yang_mills_noether.md` Proposition 1.3).
902: 
903: 2. **Fitness potential expectation:**
904: 
905: $$
906: \langle V_{\text{fit}} \rangle := \frac{1}{k} \sum_{i \in A_t} V_{\text{fit},i}
907: $$
908: 
909: is gauge-invariant.

hints.label: thm-yang-mills-action
hints.title: Yang-Mills Action Construction (To Be Proven)
hints.content:
915: :label: thm-yang-mills-action
916: 
917: Assuming gauge covariance of collective fields, construct a gauge-invariant Yang-Mills action:
918: 
919: $$
920: S[\psi, d', r'] = \int dt \sum_i \mathcal{L}_{\text{matter}}(\psi_i, D_\mu \psi_i) + \mathcal{L}_{\text{gauge}}(F_{\mu\nu})
921: $$
922: 
923: where:
924: - $D_\mu$ is the gauge-covariant derivative constructed from d'_i and r'_i
925: - $F_{\mu\nu}$ is the field strength tensor
926: - The action is invariant under combined gauge transformation of ψ_i and the collective fields
